msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Leviticus 21
ab.l:
And
the Lord said to Moses, ‘Speak to the priests,
the sons of Aaron, and say to them, “A priest shall not become unclean for a soul
among his people.

And for his sister,
the virgin, who is nearest to him, who has not been a husband’s:
he may become unclean for her.

The priest shall not become unclean
among his people, to defile himself.

They shall not make any bald place on their head,
and they shall not shave off the edge of their beard and they shall draw no lines in their flesh.

They shall be holy to their God,
they shall not defile the name of their God,
because they bring forward the offerings of the Lord made by fire, the bread of their God,
and they shall be holy.

They shall not take a wife that is a harlot or with defiled head.
And they shall not take a woman divorced from her husband, because he is holy to his God.

You shall regard him as holy, because he brings forward the offering
of your God. He shall be holy to you, because I, the Lord,
who sanctifies you, am holy.

And the daughter of a priest: if she becomes defiled,
to prostitute, she defiles her father. She shall be burned in fire.

And the one who is the superior priest among his brothers
on whose head the anointing oil was poured and
whose hand was filled to put on the garments,
shall not uncover his head and shall no rip his clothes,

And
shall not come to any dead soul, he shall not become unclean for his father or for his mother.

And he shall go out of the sanctuary, and
he shall not defile the sanctuary of his God, because the crown of the anointing oil
of his God is on him. I am the Lord.

And the
High Priest shall take a wife in her virginity.

A widow
or a woman divorced from her husband or defiled headed harlot: he shall not take these,
but he shall only take a virgin of his own people for a wife.

He shall not defile his offspring among his people, because I am
the Lord who sanctifies him.”’

And the Lord spoke to Moses,
saying,

‘Speak to Aaron, saying, “Any
man of your offspring throughout their generations that has any blemish shall not come near
to bring forward the offering of his God.

Because any man in whom is a
blemish shall not come near: a blind man or lame or the one who has any limb too short
or the one who has any limb too long,

Or a man that has
a broken leg or a broken hand,

Or
a hunchbacked or a dwarfed or |with| a cataract in his eye or
†swollen or distorted or of swollen nakedness.

Any man that has a blemish from the offspring of Aaron, the
priest, shall come near to bring forward the offerings of the Lord made by fire. He has a blemish,
he shall not come near to bring forward the offering of his God.
He shall eat the bread of his God from the holy of holies and from the holies.

Just: he shall come to the veil and he shall
not come near to the altar, because he has a blemish. And he shall not defile my sanctuaries,
because I am the Lord who sanctifies them.”’

And
Moses spoke to Aaron and to his sons and to all the children of Israel.

app.note: An uncertain translation of quršanɣy, cf. BHeb. גָּרָב ‘eczema and swell of the skin’. Cf. Lev 22:22.
